I picture Steve being perfectly okay with it, especially after the day he runs into Tiny Princess Captain America, trick-or-treating in the city along with a bunch of other kids. And she kinda stops in the crowd, and gets this great big smile on her face, and bolts down the sidewalk and up to him, and she just canât say anything because sheâs just in AWE.

Then Steve remembers that time Thor told him about how much he loves his little-girl fans, and how when he meets them he lets them âholdâ Mjolnir, and also Steve thinks about Thorâs room full of little girl drawings at Stark Tower. (Yes, I *did* just manage to connect this with that Littlest Thor Fangirl post that went around a while ago.) Normally Steven doesnât get recognized quite like the rest of the Avengers when heâs not in uniform except by elderly folks who remember him from the old days, but since the attack on New York, plenty of younger people and kids spot him on the street out of uniform and know him, just like this little girl.

So Steve asks, âWhatâs your name?â To which she finally says, âTiny Princess Captain America!â And he laughs, and then whispers, âI meant your secret identity.â So she tells him, and gives him a big hug, and then runs off to rejoin the other trick-or-treaters.

A week later, she gets a letter in the mail from Stark Tower, and when she opens it she gasps, because itâs a drawing of Captain America and Tiny Princess Captain America fighting bad guys and saving the world together.

I had to.
